resources.string: Couldn\'t load latest available legal warning.
Couldn\'t load latest accepted legal warning.
My transit agency is not listed
If you did not find your transit agency on the list, you can write a comment in the Play Store and ask the author to add your city\'s transit agency to the app.
Point the camera lens towards a public transportation vehicle. You can find information about the recognized line at the bottom of the screen.
Why do I have to choose a vehicle type?
Narrowing down a vehicle type criterion improves accuracy of line number recognition.

The basis for recognizing the line number of a public transportation vehicle is the image from the camera. Without it, the application will not be able to recognize the line number. Do you want to try again?
The location is needed to determine the stop where the user currently is. Determining the stop increases the accuracy of the results. Do you want to try again?

The evaluation was made on the basis of the hardware capabilities of the camera read from the device. The higher the rating, the more accurate the vehicle recognition can be. Usually, devices from a higher price range have a camera with more possibilities.
Do you want to read introduction?
No, go to the next screen
You can go to the introduction screen later. You can enter the screen from the app\'s settings.

Welcome to the application designed for the blind and visually impaired. The main task of the application is to recognize the line number of a public transport vehicle.

The application consists of two main screens: the screen for selecting the type of vehicle you want to recognize and the screen for recognizing the line number of the vehicle.

In the vehicle selection screen, it is possible to choose one of the two available vehicle types. It can be a tram or a bus. After selecting the type, the user is taken to the line number recognition screen.

The line number recognition screen uses a camera to transmit the image to the analyzing engine. If the line number is recognized, this information will be presented at the bottom of the screen. The bottom part of the screen consists of two elements: the number of the recognized line and the level of probability that it is the line.
